intro: Aspicarpa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy aspicarpa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, clustered white flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Aspicarpa hirsuta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
